alert.note: Alert for Itawamba; Lee; Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 8:25PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Itawamba, southeastern Lee and northeastern Monroe Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 821 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Evergreen, or 7 miles southeast of Tombigbee State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fulton, Smithville, Tremont, New Salem, Evergreen, Nettleton, Abney, Cardsville, Turon, Tilden, Ballardsville, Jacinto, Parham, Cadamy and Richmond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern Mississippi.
